Location:
- Photo of “Quarterly Rental Home Inspection Checklist” with handwritten notes (Portuguese), likely for unit noted as “4666 12th”

Observations:
- Notes cite: cigarette odor
- Broken blinds in living room; broken/missing blinds in bedroom
- A/C reported off
- Bathtub getting stained/dirty
- Walls dirty
- Kitchen cabinet broken
- Return-air/filter grille reportedly screwed shut
- Tall grass
- Grass/vegetation growing into exterior A/C unit
- Electronic lock present; battery noted low/ending soon

Potential Issues:
- Evidence of indoor smoking (odor)
- Broken/missing blinds (damage; privacy/UV concerns)
- Kitchen cabinet broken (loose/damaged fixture)
- Bathtub stained/soiled (possible hygiene/mildew risk)
- Return-air/filter grille screwed closed (blocked access; possible airflow restriction)
- Vegetation encroaching on exterior A/C (airflow obstruction; pest/damage risk)
- Tall grass (pest harborage; maintenance deficiency)
- Electronic lock low battery (risk of lockout/security issue)
- A/C off at time of notes—system operation not verified
- No visible dents, bends, warping, cracks, gaps, substrate exposure, corrosion, leaks/stains, mold/mildew, improper wiring, or trip hazards shown in the photo itself

Recommendations:
- Enforce no-smoking policy; deodorize/clean surfaces and HVAC if needed
- Repair/replace damaged and missing blinds
- Repair kitchen cabinet; secure/replace hardware
- Deep-clean bathtub; inspect for mildew and re-caulk if needed
- Clean/paint walls as needed
- Make return-air grille operable; replace filter; do not screw it shut
- Clear vegetation around A/C (minimum ~24 in clearance); service and test unit
- Mow/maintain lawn routinely
- Replace electronic lock batteries; verify operation and provide backup key
- Operate/test A/C cooling and document performance; schedule re-inspection to confirm corrections
